p: Currently, an ITM strategy for vector control is in Stage 1 of VCAG evaluations ( Fig 1), with permethrin (a pyrethroid) being the only active ingredient used in ITMs due to requirements of meeting human safety profiles [ 55]. Permethrin ITMs have demonstrated personal protection against A. aegypti mosquitoes in various laboratory experiments [ 56â€“ 58], reduction of A. aegypti human biting rates by 50% (partial limb coverage) to 100% (when fully clothed) in semifield trials [ 57, 58], and an 80% reduction in A. aegypti densities after just one month of children wearing permethrin treated school uniforms [ 59]. Models have estimated permethrin-treated uniforms could reduce dengue infections by up to 55% in the most optimistic scenarios [ 60].
